Articles.Content: So, I've only seen one working helicopter mock-up made before. I've forgot most of the inner workings of it. I'm curious how people have managed a sort of helicopter-esque design. Not using propeller or helicopter blade type mods of course... More of impromptu helicopters. Recently I tried sticking a makeshift helicopter blade out of wings attached to a free-spinning infernal robotics docking ring, and while I can get the thing spinning fast as heck with sepratrons it seems to impart no lift on the vehicle. I'm going to try a more quadracopter approach tonight but in the mean time I'm hoping people can share their experiences or point me at some good reference material. Thanks

remember to tilt them backwards slightly from the direction they'll be headed. 0 AoA(Angle of Attack) produces 0 lift.

Never built one like that on my own before, but I know enough about helicopters to know that.

Ya I did try and go pretty much straight up, I had my wings angled down to the prograde of the spin if that makes sense. I don't know to much about helicopters but that always seems to be a thing in the ones I've looked at

I have DCS BlackShark, needless to say I only got about 3 hours into it before I realized I'm not a helicopter pilot LOL. I'll try putting the whole thing on taller launch platform so I can give it a proper angle of attack from the getgo. Bear in mind I had no tail rudder or anything either, I'm merely trying to get lift out of the primary blade at the moment

You've got them angled wrong I think...the prograde side needs to be angled up. Think of a sealing fan.
